understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named prevalentSystem() which checks if a variable _prevalentSystem is null and throws an IllegalStateException if it is.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration in the sense that it enforces a requirement for the prevalent system to be configured before it can be used. This ensures that the prevalent system is properly initialized before any operations are performed on it.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _prevalentSystem is used in the code to initialize a GenericSnapshotManager object. It is used to set up the snapshot manager with the necessary serializers, snapshot suffix, prevalent system, directory, and journal serializer.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration _prevalentSystem is triggered whenever the snapshot manager is being initialized. The frequency of triggering depends on how often the snapshot manager is created or accessed in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _prevalentSystem configuration option on the system is that it affects how the snapshot manager is set up and configured. It determines the behavior of the snapshot manager and how it handles snapshots and serialization.
